contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox station | name = Greensborough | type = | style = Melbourne | image = GreensboroughBuildingPlatform1.JPG | image_caption = | address = | country = | coordinates = {{coord|-37.7040|145.1081|format=dms|type:railwaystation_region:AU-VIC|display=inline,title}} | line = <!-- line information is detailed under "services" --> | other = | structure = | platform = 2 | depth = | levels = | tracks = 2 | parking = | bicycle = | baggage_check = | opened = | closed = | rebuilt = | electrified = | ADA = | code = GRB | owned = [[VicTrack]] | operator = | zone = | smartcardname = [[Myki]] zone | smartcardstatus = <span style="color:blue;">2</span> | status = [[Premium Station]] | former = | passengers = | pass_year = | pass_percent = | pass_system = | mpassengers = | services = {{s-rail|title=Metro Trains}} {{s-line|system=Victoria|line=Hurstbridge|previous=Watsonia |next=Montmorency }} | map_locator = [http://maps.google.com/maps?ie=UTF8&om=1&z=16&ll=-37.704026,145.10813&spn=0.01258,0.019956 Link] | Melway = [http://www.street-directory.com.au/sd3/map.php?x=145.10816857598527&y=-37.70396297635319&l=13&mt=4 Link] | web = [http://www.metlinkmelbourne.com.au/stop/view/19985 Link, includes timetables] }} '''Greensborough''' is a [[railway station]] in [[Melbourne]], [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]], [[Australia]], located in the suburb of [[Greensborough, Victoria|Greensborough]], on the [[Hurstbridge railway line]]. Greensborough is classed as a [[Premium Station]] and is in [[Metcard]] <span style="color:blue;">Zone 2</span>. ==Station overview== ===Facilities=== Greensborough is located between Para Road and Poulter Avenue, with station access from both. [[Greensborough Plaza]] is a short walk from the station. The station consists of two platforms, in an [[Island platform|island format]] (platforms are not aligned though). The [[island platform]] has a large brick building housing an enclosed waiting area, ticket facilities and toilets. A large [[Metcard]] ticket vending machine is located inside the waiting area, which is able to dispense most ticketing options available and also accept notes and coins. Additional coin only Metcard & [[myki]] ticket vending machines are also located inside the waiting area. A footbridge is located at the [[Flinders Street Station|Flinders Street]] end of the station. Greensborough marks the end of the [[double track]] section of the Hurstbridge line. Trains travelling further down the line can face delays of up to 10 minutes at Greensborough when late trains towards the city occupy the [[single track (rail)|single track]] section between [[Eltham railway station, Melbourne|Eltham]] and Greensborough. Numerous weekday services in [[peak hour]]s from the Melbourne CBD terminate Greensborough, as do extra services provided on the Hurstbridge line for major events, which with the exception of [[New Years Eve]] services, are only normally provided as far as Greensborough. ===History=== Greensborough station opened on 5 June 1902.<ref>[http://www.vicsig.net/index.php?page=infrastructure&name=Greensborough Greensborough - VICSIG Infrastructure]</ref> It was upgraded to a Premium Station on 21 June 1996.<ref name="Newsrail">{{cite journal | year = 1997 | month = October | title = Upgrading Eltham to a Premium Station | journal = Newsrail | publisher = Australian Railway Heritage Society (Victorian Division) | pages = page 310 }}</ref> ===Platforms, services and connecting bus services=== '''Platform 1:''' *'''[[Hurstbridge railway line|Hurstbridge line]]''' - all stations and limited stops services to Flinders Street. *'''[[Hurstbridge railway line|Hurstbridge line]]''' - all stations services to Eltham and [[Hurstbridge railway station|Hurstbridge]]. '''Platform 2:''' *'''[[Hurstbridge railway line|Hurstbridge line]]''' - all stations services to Eltham and Hurstbridge. *'''[[Hurstbridge railway line|Hurstbridge line]]''' - all stations and limited stops services to Flinders Street. (Note: Both platforms are [[wikt:bidirectional|bi-directional]], and during peak periods are used fairly evenly for trains travelling in both directions). ===Gallery=== <gallery> Image:GreensboroughStationEntrance.JPG|Entrance to the station </gallery> ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{commons category-inline|Greensborough railway station, Melbourne}} [[Category:Railway stations in Melbourne]] [[Category:Railway stations opened in 1902]] {{Melbourne-rail-stub}}
